# p.post

<!-- badges: start -->
<!-- badges: end -->

The goal of p.post is to populate a spreadsheet with the number of successes required for a range of parameters:  

* n
* p1
* p2 

## Installation

You can install the latest version of p.post from [GitHub](https://github.com/) with:

``` {r, eval = FALSE}
# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("reevesj53/p.post")
```
## Example
The code below shows an example of output for a success rate of 0.3, and a posterior probability of exceeding the success rate ranfing from 0.5 to 0.8.

```{r example}
library(p.post)
p1 <- 0.3
p2 <- seq(0.5, 0.8, 0.1)
post_prob <- calc_post(80, p1, p2)
```
The resulting data frame is shown below.
```{r out}
post_prob
```
